comments:
If you try to build a Make Target AND you have auto-save-before-build turned on
AND you have unsaved changes, you get:

    Target Build Error

    Error Building Target

    Reason:
     Internal Error

The log shows:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui 4 0 Nov 25, 2003 15:44:18.359
!MESSAGE Invalid thread access
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Invalid thread access
    at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2330)
    at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2260)
    at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:385)
    at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.checkWidget(Widget.java:315)
    at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.isEnabled(Control.java:1108)
    at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchWindow.run(WorkbenchWindow.java:1381)
    at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.runProgressMonitorOperation(EditorManager.java:966)
    at org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorManager.savePart(EditorManager.java:1095)
    at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.savePart(WorkbenchPage.java:2353)
    at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.saveEditor(WorkbenchPage.java:2365)
    at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.TargetBuild.saveAllResources(TargetBuild.java:63)
    at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.TargetBuild$2.run(TargetBuild.java:88)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1595)
    at org.eclipse.cdt.make.ui.TargetBuild$1.run(TargetBuild.java:95)
    at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:101)
